nodes.text: The Vassek system was a remote star system located in the Wazta sector of the Outer Rim Territories. It contained the planet Vassek—which it received its name from—its three moons, and several other planets. The system also did not receive many visitors and offered no resources that were not common in others, so its planets were noted and named but generally ignored.

Vassek's third moon, Vassek 3, was home to the personal castle of Kaleesh Separatist Alliance General Grievous during the Clone Wars. In 21 BBY, Vassek 3 served as the site of an engagement between Grievous and the forces of Jedi General Kit Fisto.

A remote star system, the Vassek system was located in the Wazta sector of the Outer Rim Territories, at grid square I-17 on the Standard Galactic Grid. It contained the planet Vassek—which the system received its name from—its three moons, and several other planets. The planet's third moon, Vassek 3, served as the home of Kaleesh Separatist General Grievous's castle.

Distant from the Koda Spur hyperspace route, the Vassek system received few visitors. The system's planets also offered no resources that were not commonly found on other planets with far less effort, and so both the system and its planets were noted and named but generally ignored.

In 21 BBY, during the Clone Wars between the Galactic Republic and Confederacy of Independent Systems, Jedi General Kit Fisto traveled to the Vassek system in search of the Trade Federation Viceroy Nute Gunray, who had previously escaped Republic custody. Tracking a homing beacon from the Republic vessel Gunray stole, Fisto landed on the surface of Vassek 3, where he reunited with his former Padawan, Jedi Knight Nahdar Vebb, and Vebb's squad of clone troopers, who had also been tasked with locating the Viceroy.

While on the moon, the Republic forces entered a concealed fortress and continued their search. However, they discovered that Gunray was nowhere near and instead found themselves in an encounter with General Grievous. During the encounter, Grievous managed to kill all Republic forces, excluding Fisto, who was forced to escape from the Kaleesh and the system.

The Vassek system first appeared in the opening newsreel of "Rookies," the fifth episode of the first season of the Star Wars: The Clone Wars television series, which aired on October 24, 2008. The system was later identified in its full appearance in "Lair of Grievous," the first season's tenth episode, which aired on December 12, 2008.
